overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a systematic approach to time-series forecasting focused on identifying patterns in limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst prioritizes daily seasonality detection, evaluates model suitability given data constraints, and selects a simple averaging method as the optimal solution. The approach emphasizes robustness over complexity due to the small dataset size.
common_data_patterns: Consistent hourly patterns with nighttime dips and daytime peaks
No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex model usage (e.g., SARIMA/ETS) due to insufficient seasonal cycles
Daily patterns show inter-day variation but maintain consistent hourly profiles
Averaging same-hour values across available days provides more stability than single-day replication
Data completeness verification is essential before processing
Forecast horizon (96 hours) matches historical data length, enabling pattern repetition
complexity_analysis: Moderate complexity: Involves data pattern analysis, model comparison, and method justification, but implements a computationally simple solution (hourly averaging) due to data limitations.
